Title: C.O.P.E. to screen 10m women for breast cancer by 2030
Summary: The Care, Organisation, Public Enlightenment Foundation (C.O.P.E.) has set a target to reach 10 million Nigerian women by 2030 through expanded breast cancer screening, community education, and strengthened partnerships to promote early detection nationwide . Breast cancer is a disease in Nigeria .

Title: Swiss envoy harps on inclusion of women in governance
Summary: Swiss envoy harps on inclusion of women in governance . Deputy Ambassador of Switzerland to Nigeria said women's inclusion in governance should not be regarded as a favour .

Title: Why we arrested Sowore in court — Police spokesperson
Summary: Omoyele Sowore is the 2023 presidential candidate of the African Action Congress . The Force Public Relations Officer, CSP Benjamin Hundeyin, explained why he was taken into custody .

Title: Noise Pollution: Lagos govt seals church after shunning peace agreement
Summary: Lagos State Environmental Protection Agency (LASEPA) sealed Cherubim and Seraphim King of Kings Church at 24, Georgius Cole Street, Ifako-Ijaye, for noise pollution . The closure was issued on the directive of the State Commissioner .

Title: Police arraign man for wife’s murder in Enugu
Summary: Livinus Okoh, 46, charged with the murder of his wife, Onyinyechi, at Amuri, Nkanu West LGA of the state . This was even as the Enugu State Government had condemned the alleged killing in strong words .

Title: Nigeria’s Solid Minerals being illegally mined, stolen — NEC raises alarm
Summary: The National Economic Council (NEC) has raised alarm over large-scale illegal mining and theft of Nigeria’s solid minerals, including gold, warning that the proceeds are being siphoned without remittance to the national treasury .

Title: PCN seals 498 premises in Lagos over illegal drug sales, regulatory violations
Summary: The Pharmacy Council of Nigeria (PCN) has sealed 498 pharmaceutical premises across Lagos State for violating regulations governing pharmacy practice and the handling of medicines in the country . PCN seals 498 premises in Lagos over illegal drug sales .

Title: Reps move to deepen access to finance, protect bank customers with new financial bills
Summary: Reps move to deepen access to finance, protect bank customers with new financial bills . House of Representatives Committee on Banking Regulations held a public hearing on two critical bills . The bills are aimed at strengthening Nigeria’s financial system and protecting bank customers from fraudulent activities .

Title: EFCC vows to prosecute corrupt politicians without bias
Summary: Olukoyede said the anti-graft agency would not protect any politician who defected to the ruling party . He said the EFCC remained impartial in all its operations .

Title: Shifting burden of proof to INEC good if pursued with sincerity — Labour Party
Summary: The Labour Party (LP) described the proposal by the Senate to shift the burden of proof to INEC as a welcome development . If pursued with sincerity and safeguards against abuse, it will be good if pursued, says the party .
